transportAdvice: Hiroshima has an efficient tram network that connects most major tourist sites, including the Peace Memorial Park and Hiroshima Castle, making it easy to get around without a car. Taxis are widely available and metered, and the city center is compact enough for comfortable walking between many attractions.

weather.description: Cold and dry with occasional frost, clear skies are common making it a crisp but manageable time to visit.
Still cold but early plum blossoms begin to appear, offering a hint of the coming spring.
Temperatures warm noticeably and cherry blossoms begin to bloom toward the end of the month.
Peak cherry blossom season makes this one of the most beautiful and popular months to visit.
Warm and pleasant with lush greenery, ideal conditions for outdoor sightseeing.
The rainy season brings frequent showers and rising humidity, making it feel muggy and warm.
Hot and humid with heavy rainfall early in the month before the rainy season typically ends.
The hottest month of the year with intense heat and humidity; the Peace Memorial Ceremony takes place on August 6th.
Typhoon season brings a risk of heavy rain and strong winds, though heat begins to ease toward month's end.
Comfortable autumn temperatures and early fall foliage make this an excellent month for sightseeing.
Autumn foliage peaks and the weather is cool and dry, one of the best months to visit.
Cold and quiet with a festive atmosphere, occasional frost is possible but snow is rare in the city.
